newsitem.title: USA: VDC to acquire rest of netValue Inc.
newsitem.headline: VDC to acquire rest of netValue Inc.

text.p: VDC Corp, an investment holding company based in Hamilton, Bermuda, said Thursday it has reached an agreement to acquire the 83 percent stake in privately-held netValue Inc that it does not yet own.
VDC said it plans to issue about 3.3 million of its common shares to pay for the proposed acquisition. VDC's closing price of $5.00 on April 23 values the deal at $16.5 million.
In August, VDC acquired a 16.5 percent stake in netValue, then known as COL Acquisition Corp.
NetValue, based in Stamford Conn., is an interactive marketing company that plans to launch its first product, Coupons Online, later this month.
The product will enable retailers, manfacturers and service providers to deliver secured, fraud-resistant coupons and other communications to consumers from any Web site on the Internet.
Closing of the transaction is expected to take place early this summer and is contingent on, among other things, shareholder approval.
The deal is also contingent upon the appointment of Michael Clark, netValue's president and chief executive officer, to the VDC board.
